description: Hope this stays a secret find. The rib bao and ramen are the best. Asian comfort food on a cold night is my jam. Been there twice this week and already hankering for another go.
author: Grace C.

description:
My husband and I are turning into a grouchy old married couple, skeptically eyeing new places that pop up in our neighborhood. We watched the drawn-out drama with Local's Corner and then saw it close and very eagerly anticipated what would fill the vacancy. And there it was: Spice Jar. Using our dogs as a daily excuse to walk by, we'd peer in, check out the posted menu, and sort of scrunch up our noses thinking...good luck. A 'Greatest Hits' of Asian food??? What????

Well, I'd say they're about a month in now and we decided it was a good time to check it out. First thing: they got a hood!!!! That was one thing Local's Corner said they weren't able to have in that space, which was why they used induction. But Spice Jar managed to get it approved, which was great to see.

Every single person we encountered was SUPER nice and attentive. It's a small space and they were packed. But everything flowed so smoothly. No one appeared stressed and we never had long waits for drinks, refills, or food. They were functioning as though this place had been here for years. 

For drinks, we ordered a couple different beers. We love beer and were thrilled to see beers on tap. I tried the green tea iced tea and loved it. Super refreshing and not at all sweet. Great for green tea lovers. 

For appetizers, we ordered the har gow and chicken karaage. Both were fine. Nothing spectacular but just right for a local comfort food place. Yes, we've had better har gow and chicken karaage but for a place literally right around the corner from home, we were totally happy.

The tonkotsu ramen and chicken green curry came next. My husband is a ramen freak. We love Ivan Ramen and Momofuku in NY. In the Bay Area, Ramen Shop in Oakland is by far our favorite. We weren't expecting to be thrilled by Spice Jar's ramen but were very pleasantly surprised. Of course, if we have the choice, we'd obviously take Ramen Shop any day. But again, to have this less than 5 minutes away on foot is a miracle. It's a totally decent, good solid ramen. Finally, my green curry! I want to eat green curry right up until I die and am forever in search of good ones wherever I go. (Coincidentally, we recent visited Farmhouse Kitchen, a new Thai restaurant also in the Mission where I ordered green curry. Now, my husband and I have eaten green curry a bazillion times from New York, Boston, San Francisco, Paris, Berlin...and Thailand on many occasions. So I think it's safe to say that we're fair judges of what green curry should look and taste like. Not to get off track since this is a review of Spice Jar, but we were horrified by Farmhouse Kitchen's green curry. HORRIFIED.) Okay, I'm back. Spice Jar's green curry really made me smile. Seriously. They nailed the flavor and consistency. The chicken was super tender and moist. They could toss in some more goodies as it was just some eggplant, cherry tomatoes and a little basil. But all in all I am on my knees thanking heaven for access to some very good green curry a stone's throw from my front door. 

And the price!!! All that for fifty-something dollars?!?! How happy are we?!? For a small neighborhood restaurant, they're doing a lovely job. Great addition to the neighborhood. Great service. Great value.
author: Amy K.

description: 3.5 stars? Really wanted to like this place, and it's not like I dis-like it, but it didn't wow me or make me want to think I ought to go there again. At least not for now. It's a cute corner restaurant with decent menu and super kind staff (which I assume is the owner). Food wasn't bad either, but again, no wow factor. If I lived near-by, I might be a regular, but living down this far on the peninsula, it's hard for me to recommend it over at least a handful of other similar joints in San Francisco. Nice interior deco, good beer selection, easy to park.
author: Sokokyu K.

description: Excellent green curry! Fun place, I will come back often. Very small and a long wait depending on the time and day. Worth the wait! Gochisoosama desita!
author: Keith H.

description: What a neighborhood gem. Great food, lovely owners, and a fun atmosphere makes this place truly special. Consider me a fan.
author: Josh H.

description:
I'm glad that I found this place, it offers something different than what you'd usually get in the Mission. 

About others who are angry about Laska not being authentic, honestly, I'm Malaysian and I don't think it's bad and it totally satisfied my crave. Sure - it's fried tofu and not tofu puffs, but it's still yummy tofu. The broth, not as spicy as original flavor, but still thick and has that grainy curry powder texture. Overall, it's 3 out of 5 for authenticity, but I still think it's a good dish and I'll have it again.

The other dish we had was Calamari Salad. It's good portion of calamari, crispy on the outside and absorb some of the salad dressing which is very delicious. I can't wait already to come back for it.
author: Guacamole L.

description: Full disclosure I wasn't super hungry when we went to spice jar so only can refer to the lettuce cups and salmon. Both were delicious. Salmon can be so boring because it is over done and of course there is the concern about sustainability .  That aside the salmon was delicately spiced ( almost too delicate ) the presentation was nice but overall the atmosphere of spice jar is friendly and welcoming. Want to return to try some more adventurous dishes.
author: elizabeth m.

description:
3.5 stars. 
This new restaurant is still working out kinks.  
Friday night dinner was very crowded, about 20 min wait to sit, and then another 20 minutes for food to arrive (2 bowls of noodles).  The owners should probably streamline the menu to account for the small kitchen and limited cooks. If you have to make 5 kinds of (very different) noodle broths, on top of all these other menu items, it's going to take forever to serve everyone.  
Table next to me complained that their appetizer dumplings arrived 40 minutes into the dinner (after they were already full from everything else, and tried to send it back, but the server said something about how he is just the server and couldn't do anything about the speed of food).  

Pho ga was light and not strongly flavored; the chicken was rubbery and dry.  When the waitress asked how my food was, I showed her the rubber chicken and she immediately took it away to remake it (even though I insisted I didn't mind eating the noodles alone).  Although this was very nice, my eating companion was then left with the problem of eating alone or waiting for my food to be remade while his soup got cold.  
Zen noodle soup was fine but nowhere near the spice or deliciousness of comparable noodle soups at Kitchen Story.   
Also got some mongolian beef and fried rice to go, nothing special there.  Next time, I would probably stick with the japanese menu items.  
Matcha iced tea was delicious! 
Overall a very clean, hip place with decent food but nothing too special.  The owners are very kind and caring and I hope they work things out!
author: T Y.

description: Most dishes were extremely rich and well arranged, but almost nothing we ate stood out as delicious. The selection felt limited and significantly less well rounded than I was expecting given the rave reviews here on Yelp.
author: Ben G.

description: Such a cozy lil neighborhood restaurant. We ordered the chicken karaage, the calamari salad, and the Mongolian lamb. The Chicken was perfect; salad was pretty damn good too; the lamb was cooked perfectly (but surprisingly) seemed to lack the distinct flavor of lamb. The service was spot-on, and a great experience in general. The Spice Jar will be here to stay!
author: Vivek N.

description: This is one of my favorite soup places, we have tried every soup on the menu now and they are all amazing!!
author: Alexandrina O.

description: Great flavor in a heapin bowl o noodles. And very nice friendly service. Cozy tree house feel. I'll be back.
author: brian s.

description: I love this little place. Went here for lunch the other day. Ordered the zen noodles. At first I thought from pictures it was like Korean Jambong but the soup was more like a coconut soup with lemon grass and Vietnamese rice noodles. It was a nice little surprise, nicely balanced and not too heavy. I think the best part was the lemon ginger drink. Service was also really friendly. I will definitely come back and try other dishes. Oh and decor is really nicely done. Small space so it feels intimate.
author: Sam S.

description: Delicious food, welcoming service. Just what I like!
author: Alexander H.

description: I loved the mongolian beef and the chicken green curry. I can't wait to come back to try the calamari salad and the pho ga.
author: Amin S.

description: Loved our dinner at Spice Jar. We enjoyed ramen and mishu hanger steak, which were delicious. The Asahi beer imported from Japan was a perfect accompaniment. The atmosphere is cozy and the service attentive. Good price too!
author: Michaella S.

description:
tasty food at a decent price 
big improvement over "local's" corner
author: Ryan F.

description:
i really love this place , good food , great addition , and very authentic 
une bonne adresse avec un service tres attentionné
author: Gilberte G.

description: This is our go-to restaurant in San Francisco. The owners created a menu of things they love to eat, and the love shines through their food. It's a place where people feel comfortable and leave satisfied. The prices are incredibly reasonable for the quality. It's all good. We'd eat here every week, and often do. Don't miss the miso ramen and the homemade tofu.
author: John T.

description: Sweetest little spot in the mission! We were so excited to see this delicious spot take over the old Locals Corner property. The owner personally dropped by our table to help me figure out what foods I could eat that are dairy and gluten free. He took care to check into every ingredient and the result was a tasty meal of curries, fried rice, and veggie dish. My dining counterparts loved the sesame bread and Buddha beer! Will be back for sure!
author: Jody N.

description:
We really enjoy the food and service of this local Mission District restaurant! I'm not going to go into the details of every dish. The bottom line is the food is creative, good portions, exceptional flavors, and very inexpensive for the city! The owner and staff are very friendly, and the service is efficient. Accordingly, they have done extremely well since opening a few months ago.

It is a small restaurant, and unfortunately doesn't take reservations. It's first come, first served, so there usually is a wait in line, but well worth it !
author: Mark S.

description:
i waited so long for the food. it never came out. it took way too long..
the service was.. just Okay...
author: Nicole R.

description: Friendly attentive waitress, cute decor, delicious food. We got the green curry with chicken and the zen noodle soup. Definitely coming back to try other items.
author: Jason S.

description: Fantastic Asian fusion food. Community friendly. Family owned. Ths best bang for your buck.
author: Emilia G.

description:
The boyfriend and I decided we wanted to try out a new restaurant and decided on the Spice Jar. And I'm so glad we did! The food here is beyond amazing!!!!!

We ordered the three dishes: Har gow, Calamari salad, and bbq korean steak with mushu wraps.

The har gow was so fresh and well-made. I'm just sad there were only four!

Now the calamari salad was delicious! My bf normally hates salad and if he does order one he never gets dressing. However, the dressing was the highlight of the night.  It packed a lot of flavor, but was light enough not to overpower the salad.  The noodles were a nice touch as well.  

Lastly, was the bbq korean steak with mushu wraps. For the mushu wraps we weren't expecting to get tortilla wraps but that's okay. The steak was perfectly cooked and just melted in your mouth. And the sauce that it was cooked in? Perfection. 

We will definitely be coming back. One of the best restaurants we have eaten at in SF.
author: Tina S.

description: Spice jar is such a great neighborhood spot! The food is delicious, service is great, and atmosphere is casual, fun.
author: Marisol R.

description: I've been here twice, once for lunch and once for dinner. I've enjoyed everything I've tried, which I had two soups, ribs, the chicken salad and the calamari salad. I recommend trying. Cute atmosphere, although it can only fit so many people, so sometimes you have to wait.
author: Jessica K.

description: Great environment and accommodations. The food is just spiced right! Fitting name! Loved the Thai curry bowl.
author: So N.

description:
After having lunch at the brand new Spice Jar I couldn't wait to write a review. This place is a treasure.
Spice Jar is a small, neighborhood restaurant that serves Asian Comfort Food. I had high expectations but the food was so much more complex and delicious than I anticipated.
My boyfriend and I shared the cucumber salad (fresh, crunchy, spicy.) Then he had the Mongolian Beef (thin slices of meat with green onion, sesame, hoisin and what tasted like a wine reduction.) I had a seafood coconut broth with basil, calamari and mussels. 
Everyone who works here is so very lovely. The wife of the owner spent a lot of time describing the dishes and outlining their most popular items (their ramen and the calamari salad looked incredible.)
I recommend you visit at slight off hours (11:50 for lunch, rather than 12:00, for example) because already the place has lines out the door at peak hours (they are very organized and seat you as quickly as they can; but the place is the type where you'd want to linger rather than rush.)
author: D Z.

description: My husband and I went to Spice Jar on a Friday at 7:00 pm and were seated within 5 minutes. We are vegetarian so we had a good variety of options in food. We ordered the vegetable gyoza, tofu steak and vegetarian ramen. Taste wise food was great! I usually don't like tofu, but the tofu steak was really good. They don't have a full bar, but good variety of beer, wine and sake. Good value for money. Would go again!
author: Isha J.

description:
Sorry to report that from 4 visits I had two times chicken that didn't taste good: It had a taste of not quite fresh. I had 3 times the Pho and one time the chicken green curry. I really wanted to like this place and the people running it are super nice (I would give 5 stars for that). But finding chicken with a side taste is not something I can recommend. 

The cook told me the chicken gets cooked in the morning. I believe chicken stays fresh for a while after it has been cooked, so I assume the chicken is either not getting cooked right away after it's bought OR not stored cold enough OR the vendor might not store the chicken correctly. When I buy chicken, I make sure I cook it within a few hours or I freeze it.
author: Mpunkt H.

description: Great new spot in the neighborhood!! You have to try the ribs bao - simply amazing!  Very friendly staff too - we will definitely be back!
author: Lars W.

description: My husband and I live in North Bernal and have walked by several times but there was always a line so we did not stop.  We finally went early enough the other night to snag a table (no reservations) and it was delicious!  We will definitely be back.  Great food and service.
author: Phil D.

description:
Sooo happy about this new addition to the neighborhood! First of all, lovely owners - always a perk when the owners actually run the place & are the ones giving you their recommendations etc.! Food was absolutely delicious - wish we could've tried everything, but we'll be back to fix that! Great variation of dishes (also beverages btw, the homemade mint ginger lemonade is bomb!), and all of them are perfectly flavorful and clearly cooked with passion.
And of course, all that for a more than fair price, which seems to get harder and harder to find in SF. Absolutely love and will definitely be back!
author: F F.

description: Over rated, I had the most boring chicken karaage here, how can you make fried chicken taste so boring?! Had their sesame ramen and tonkatsu ramen, both taste either like Chinese nor Japanese, taste very weird, yes, weird is the only word I can use to describe their food. The food taste very immature, the meat in ramen taste like over night stiff and dried out Chinese left over just taken out from the refrigerator, the minced chicken in sesame ramen is sweet, and just weird. Like what we use for chicken fried rice. The whole thing taste like an experiment, put all together with left over Chinese food. I am very surprise why they have high rating, then my friend told me you can pay Yelp for fake ratings. That make sense. The only thing I liked there was the service and the iced green tea in a nice glass cup. So I am giving them 3stars....
author: Diana C.

description: 3.5 with food: all the curry dishes are similar to each other and options are limited. not much freshness of seafood in the penang curry... vibe is good. service is rushing.
author: Shuting Z.

description: The green curry is out of this world. Perfect amount of spices blended together with tender chicken and vegetables.
author: J Y.

description: For appetizers we had the har gow and edamame hummus jar and they were absolutely amazing. The rice paper wrapping on the har gow was absolutely fresh and gooey and so yummy. Then we ordered the fried rice and that was good too. We also ordered spring roles and the inside  of it was so good. It had this pepper flavor. The customer service was amazing. They always checked in and were so friendly and kind. I'm definitely coming back with family and friends and going  to try everything!!! I would definitely suggest you try it!!!
author: Julie M.

description: This place is awesome. The food is completely delicious, and comes in generous portions at an affordable price--rare for San Francisco / Asian fusion restaurants imo. The service is also really top-notch. I recommend the Oolong tea and tofu steak. Keep in mind that the venue is small, and there may be a bit of a wait for a table, but it is absolutely well-worth it.
author: Charlotte G.

description: The owners of The Spice Jar were kind enough to accommodate us on their 'Family and Friends' preview dining evening, and we were very grateful for the experience! The service was speedy, the food was delicious, and the decor is awesome. I'm so glad this cosy spot has opened up in the Mission. Thank you!
author: Kath R.

description: Wow, wow, wow. The Spice Jar lives up to its Yelp reviews- beautiful yet simple decor, delicious and beautifully presented food, and very friendly staff. I would definitely come out my way to eat here again.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: Second time ordering and I think the problem is the lack of oomph. There's not a lot of spice, tbh, my food tasted bland.
author: Phi T.

description: Just moved to SF and had no idea where to find a good ramen place. Based on reading some initial reviews on yelp about the restaurant my boyfriend and I opted to come here on a whim- we were floored by how lovely the staff were- going out of their way to provide stellar service as well as serving amazing food. I would recommend this joint to anyone! Great staff, clean, great service and delicious food! A true gem!
author: Laura H.

description: All the food was amazing. People working here are great and attentive. Was up to my standards and beyond.
author: Martha B.

description: The food and service was fantastic.  Love ma & pa places.
author: Anna C.

description: Great place!  The owners have really put alot of attention to detail in their food and the restaurant.  All the dishes we tried were excellent: garlic edamame, pho, miso ramen, mushroom tempura, spinach and garlic rice, portobello, steak fajitas, spring rolls.  The flavors are amazing in everything as they put their own unique spin on everything.  There is always a wait but it is worth it and never more then 20 minutes.
author: Sarah A.

description: Very good Mongolian Chicken & Shrimp! The dish was very flavorful and was also quite filling. I ordered the meal to go and it was ready within 10 minutes of ordering. The owner was cheerful and very hospitable. I will definitely go here again!
author: Chris G.

description: I'm not a big fan of Asian Fusion usually, however I LOVE this place! I recently moved to Chicago, so while visiting I had to come for the oh so delicious Maui Maui. The atmosphere is so lively that I always hate to leave. Love the staff also! Very warm and friendly.
author: Kelly A.

description: What I have been waiting for in this town   Fresh, delicious, friendly.  Perfect neighborhood lunch and dinner spot serving farm to table comfort Asian food.  It's my dream come true!!!
author: Nicholas C.
